docs.snippet: The Boston Traveller of yesterday publishes a full statement from Capt. STONE, of the schooner El Dorado, the vessel which was last seen near the wreck of the Central America. The Traveller says: The schooner El Dorado, STONE, arrived here from Ga...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Boston Traveller of yesterday publishes a full statement from Capt. STONE, of the schooner El Dorado, the vessel which was last seen near the wreck of the Central America. The Traveller says: The schooner El Dorado, STONE, arrived here from Galveston 22d ult., reports that on the 11th inst., lat.

headline.main: THE CENTRAL AMERICA DISASTER.; Statement of Capt. Stone of the El Dorado--His Reasons for Forsaking the Steamer. The Central America--Reasons for Changing her Name.

docs.snippet: The ship Pollas, Captain SPILLANE, from Cork to Quebec, with one hundred and twenty passengers, sighted the coast of Cape Breton, on the morning of the 30th May. In the afternoon it was discovered that the compasses varied from one another, and th...
docs.lead_paragraph: The ship Pollas, Captain SPILLANE, from Cork to Quebec, with one hundred and twenty passengers, sighted the coast of Cape Breton, on the morning of the 30th May. In the afternoon it was discovered that the compasses varied from one another, and the course of the vessel was then shaped between Cape North and St. Pauls.

headline.main: Dreadful Shipwreek.; TOTAL LOSS OF THE SHIP PALLAS--SEVENTY TWO PERSONS DROWNED.

docs.snippet: We have received a letter from Mrs. COLE, wife of Capt. COLE, of the William Penn, which gives a very graphic description of the wreck of that vessel off Cape Hatteras, which has already been announced in our paper. The ship, it appears, run agrou...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have received a letter from Mrs. COLE, wife of Capt. COLE, of the William Penn, which gives a very graphic description of the wreck of that vessel off Cape Hatteras, which has already been announced in our paper. The ship, it appears, run aground on a shoal, on the morning of the 30th of September.

headline.main: The Wreck of the William Penn, off Cape Hatteras.

EXTENSIVE FORGERIES. $250,000 Forged Comptroller's Warrants in Circniation--The New Comptroller Missing. The Arrest of Smyth Clark for Alleged Embezzlement. Attack on Petropoloski by the English and French Fleets--Defeat of the Allies. Fate of Raousset Boulbon. Miscellaneous. LATER FROM OREGON. CHILI. BOLIVIA. PERU. ECUADOR. CALIFORNIA MARKETS. Semi-Monthly Market Review. Marriage and Deaths in California. MARRIED DIED.

docs.lead_paragraph: This steamer, as our readers were informed by telegraph, put into Norfolk in distress on Fri day night. She left New-York on Monday, the preceding, which was the 6th. headline.main: THE STEAMER GEORGIA.; PARTICULARS OF THE DISASTER. Thrilling Accounts from Passengers. Their Wrongs and Sufferings. The Ship, Owners and Commander Denounced. The Wreek and the Wrecked.

docs.snippet: The Federal Emergency Management Agency measures disasters in a way that is based not on the facts, but only on how they fit into mathematical equations....

docs.snippet: Nassau County's emergency command center for dealing with disasters is hidden amid a maze of hallways and tunnels some 25 feet beneath Police Headquarters here. But these days it is the center itself that looks as if it had been hit by a disaster....
docs.abstract: Nassau County's emergency command center for dealing with disaster appears to have been poorly and haphazardly maintained; center is hidden amid maze of hallways and tunnels some 25 feet beneath Police Headquarters in Garden City; County Exec Thomas R Suozzi tours center, to dramatize his insistence that county had better prepare itself for terrorist attacks and other disasters; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Nassau County's emergency command center for dealing with disasters is hidden amid a maze of hallways and tunnels some 25 feet beneath Police Headquarters here. But these days it is the center itself that looks as if it had been hit by a disaster. A dozen missing tiles give the ceiling a jumbled, checkerboard look. Tangles of wires and cables dangle randomly here and there. Hanging from one set of wires is a fire-alarm bell.

headline.main: Nassau's Disaster Command Post Looks a Lot Like a Disaster Site Itself

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 Nature's more violent manifestations were at a minimum in the United States and its territories during 1966 and the Office of Emergency Planning found time to study new approaches to disaster relief....
docs.abstract: Emergency Planning Office repts heavy rainfall and floods were major cause of 11 Pres declarations of disaster areas, '66
